messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:48): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: Sure
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:48): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: (Which test harness?)
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:05): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: w3c one, did you get my email btw?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:06): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: I see the email now
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:07): I know nothing about the W3C test reporting system
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:07): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: What is the question?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:07): I've heard that it's mostly manual so I haven't been inclined to have a look at it
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:09): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: just a general enquiry to how the actual reporting is done. e.g. http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/html/file/tip/tests/submission
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:09): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: i.e. how automation is best done :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:10): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: Oh, like ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c I haven't dared look at that too hard
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:11): There is a javascript thing in the repo somewhere that opens the tests in an iframe and lets people submit the results and builds that XML or something
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:11): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: if you find it let me know
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:12): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c if there are reporting / automated examples I could see, I would be grateful
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:12): http://test.w3.org/html/tests/harness/harness.htm
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:12): You click pass/fail buttons 819 times and then click "test results" and then post it to a mailing list, I think
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:13): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: Oh, ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c beat me to it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:13): The whole thing is insane
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:13): the most useful thing would be if people would stop spamming me with test results :(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:13): http://philip.html5.org/tests/canvas/suite/reportgenentry.html is my automated one but that's for a slightly obsolete version of the tests
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:13): and also you can't submit the results anywhere
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:13): But there must be something somewhere encouraging it
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:14): Also, it is quite trivial to build an automated harness for the javascript tests
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:14): Since it has an API specifically for that purpose
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (15:14): click a button 819 times? make a game out of it and people will pay to run your tests for you
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:15): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: where is this API documented?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:15): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/html/file/0be07106838c/tests/resources/testharness.js
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:15): See where it says "external API"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:16): We should totally do that
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:16): Make people pay to buy a test autoclicker than can submit 5 results for them
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:16): Make an online game like The Typing of the Dead
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:17): I was totally thinking farmville
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:17): where instead of showing you a word you have to type in to kill zombies, it shows a test case in an iframe and you have to select pass/fail to kill zombies
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:18): The end-of-level boss can be a series of test cases submitted by Microsoft where it's really hard to figure out whether it passed or failed
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (15:18): heh typing of the dead
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (15:18): someone had me playing that years ago, except it was the japanese version on DC
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:18): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: don't quite understand that "external API" stuff, was expecting to see a func with XMLHttpRequest post
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:19): "Test passes if the text 'PASS' appears to the left and the text 'Your browser does not support media elements.' does not appear anywhere on this page."
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (15:19): not being able to read any of it made the boss battles ... a challenge
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:19): That text will always appear on that page, as part of the instructions
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:20): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: so one implements result_callback to post results or something?
f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678 (15:21): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: i need an example i think
9dfea2f9bd9114520591dceb20d528a1 (15:34): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: This test intentionally left failing

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:51): f4dfad803df83144a5be86d9bca87678: If one loads the test in an iframe it will try to send the results to a function in the top-level browsing context called completion_callback
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:51): It might have been neater to use postMessage‚Ä¶
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:51): In fact it might still be possible to change
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:53): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, need any information on generating the spec?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:54): I currently use (and change ED to WD somewhere and add -F date=2011-xx-xx when generating a copy for publication):
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:54): curl -u w3c-user:password -F file=@Overview.src.html -F group=none -F output=html -F method=file http://cgi.w3.org/member-bin/process.cgi -o Overview.html
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:10): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: thanks
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:15): where do i change ED to WD?
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:20): the current version seems to be WD
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:29): I guess you can keep it that way
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:30): but if someone wants you to change it back, change WD to ED in the "This Version:" URL in http://dev.w3.org/html5/html4-differences/Overview.src.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:30): everything else should adjust automatically
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): if something breaks with the generator you probably need to contact Bert Bos or switch to Anolis
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): publication related questions are probably best directed to Mike Smith
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:31): i added myself as editor to see if it'd work
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (16:32): yeah, I can help with pub stuff
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:33): i guess i'm all set then
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:34): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: one more, what do you check when you update it? just the svn log?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:34): yes
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:34): I keep track of SVN numbers in the comments
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (16:34): how did this thread about microphone devices suddenly turn towards sh? heh
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (16:34): that may be the most nonsensical suggestion I've seen on the list yet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:35): if you look at the HTML5 changelogs section it should be pretty simple to figure out
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:35): that is, if you look at the source
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:35): feel free to make more ambitious changes though :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:35): such as defining the DOM HTML delta or some such
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:36): heh, don't worry, i won't :)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:38): btw i won't be in link??ping this week
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (16:38): so i guess i won't seeya
